p: The circulation of the only established Anopheles-mosquito-borne human arboviral pathogen, oâ€™nyong-nyong virus (ONNV), has been reported in Central Sudan with seroprevalence of 13% among the population of Sennar State [ 28]. Previous studies suggested a major epidemic, with 2 million human infections, occurred in East African countries, including Sudan, between 1959 and 1962 [ 64, 65]. Unfortunately, there are no recent studies providing up-to-date information about the epidemiology and the associated risk factors for ONNV in Sudan.
